comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: To me, it looks like they are gathering hay, not clearing land. Perhaps gathering hay was an integral part of clearing land. however I would have thought that the paddock could not be cut for hay unless the land had already been cleared. You can read an 1872 description of North Yanco station at this link: users.tpg.com.au/hayhist/south.html#fromNarr and later history here: www.dpi.nsw.gov.au/research/centres/yanco/history

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I also think they are making hay - while the sun shines.
